original_solution_mapping.L1: Bob runs .1 miles per minute because 6 / 60 = <<6/60=.1>>.1
original_solution_mapping.L2: Jim run at .15 miles per minute 9 / 60 = <<9/60=.15>>.15
original_solution_mapping.L3: We know that .1(Number of Minutes) + 1 = .15(Number of Minutes)

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 867.
    Returns: the number of minutes it will take before Jim catches Bob.
    """
    # L1
    bob_speed_mph = 6 # Bob runs 6 miles per hour
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # WK
    bob_speed_mpm = bob_speed_mph / minutes_per_hour

    # L2
    jim_speed_mph = 9 # Jim runs at 9 miles per hour
    jim_speed_mpm = jim_speed_mph / minutes_per_hour

    # L4
    bob_head_start_miles = 1 # Bob has a 1 mile head-start
    relative_speed_mpm = jim_speed_mpm - bob_speed_mpm

    # L5
    time_to_catch_minutes = bob_head_start_miles / relative_speed_mpm

    # FA
    answer = time_to_catch_minutes
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Bob runs .1 miles per minute because {bob_speed_mph} / {minutes_per_hour} = <<{bob_speed_mph}/{minutes_per_hour}={bob_speed_mpm}>>{bob_speed_mpm}
Jim run at .15 miles per minute {jim_speed_mph} / {minutes_per_hour} = <<{jim_speed_mph}/{minutes_per_hour}={jim_speed_mpm}>>{jim_speed_mpm}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Bob runs .1 miles per minute because 6 / 60 = <<6/60=0.1>>0.1
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Jim run at .15 miles per minute 60 / 60 = <<60/60=1>>1

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'minutes_per_hour' (60) was used instead of 'jim_speed_mph' (9).
